channel.title: Referencing client.java?
channel.description:
Ok, inside NPCHandler.java, how do i reference Client.java?
The following don't work..
[code] server.client.VOIDFROMCLIENT.JAVAHERE
server.clientHandler.VOIDFROMCLIENT.JAVAHERE [/code]
Thanks if you help. [url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=299427;sa=summary]WRX`[/url]

item.title: Referencing client.java?
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

Well basically i wanna do…

if (client.qStage[1] == 2) {

You get the drift, but it won’t do it. How would i do this?

Anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Referencing client.java?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“WRX`, post:5, topic:226386”][quote author=alpha_omega link=topic=297445.msg2389883#msg2389883 date=1218929567]

317s don’t use packages…

if there is a simple method in client.java use client.method(parenthesis stuff);

You idiot. They are objects. Your client.method thing is rather wrong. I don’t think the client class is static.

WRX’, learn to programming using object oriented paradigm. You need to create an object, not necessarily using the server class to instance the class. Example:

FooClass fc;

Then you would call the instance of that class through fc.fooMethod();
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/concepts/index.html
[/quote]

Do you even know what i’m trying to do?[/quote]

no because you haven’t told us…

Read full topic

You idiot. They are objects. Your client.method thing is rather wrong. I don’t think the client class is static.

WRX’, learn to programming using object oriented paradigm. You need to create an object, not necessarily using the server class to instance the class. Example:
